text.0: brisk at the place of iḷā hymned by men who wake our own familiar friend is kindled in the house.
text.1: hotar of all oblation worthy of our choice lord beaming trusty friend to one who loveth him.
text.2: he excellent in glory guest in every house finds like a swiftwinged bird a home in every tree.
text.3: benevolent to men he scorns no living man friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe.
text.4: most sage with insight passing skilful with thy powers art thou o agni wise with wisdom knowing all.
text.5: as vasu thou alone art lord of all good things of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce.
text.6: foreknowing well o agni thou in iḷās place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil.
text.7: marked are thy comings like the comings of the dawns the rays of him who shineth spotless as the sun.
text.8: thy glories are as lightnings from the rainy cloud marked manyhued like heralds of the dawns approach.
text.9: when loosed to wander over plants and forest trees thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth.
text.10: him duly coming as their germ have plants received this agni have maternal waters brought to life.
text.11: so in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore.
text.12: when sped and urged by wind thou spreadest thee abroad swift piercing through thy food according to thy will.
text.13: thy neverceasing blazes longing to consume like men on chariots agni strive on every side.
text.14: agni the hotarpriest who fills the assembly full waker of knowledge chief controller of the thought.
text.15: him yea none other than thyself doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike.
text.16: here agni the arrangers those attached to thee elect thee as their priest in sacred gatherings.
text.17: when men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment piously inclined.
text.18: thine is the heralds task and cleansers duly timed leader art thou and kindler for the pious man.
text.19: thou art director thou the ministering priest thou art the brahman lord and master in our home.
text.20: when mortal man presents to thee immortal god agni his fuel or his sacrificial gift.
text.21: then thou art his adhvaryu hotar messenger callest the gods and orderest the sacrifice.
text.22: from us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him these holy words these Ṛcas songs and eulogies.
text.23: eager for wealth to jātavedas fain for wealth when they have waxen strong they please their strengthener.
text.24: this newest eulogy will i speak forth to him the ancient one who loves it may he hear our voice.
text.25: may it come near his heart and make it stir with love as a fond welldressed matron clings about her lord.
text.26: he in whom horses bulls oxen and barren cows and rams when duly set apart are offered up.
text.27: to agni somasprinkled drinker of sweet juice disposer with my heart i bring a fair hymn forth.
text.28: into thy mouth is poured the offering agni as soma into cup oil into ladle.
text.29: vouchsafe us wealth strengthwinning blest with heroes wealth lofty praised by men and full of splendour.
